# Nisko, Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship

Nisko  is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Bisztynek, within Bartoszyce County, Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship, in northern Poland. It lies approximately  east of Bisztynek,  south-east of Bartoszyce, and  north-east of the regional capital Olsztyn.
Before 1772 the area was part of Kingdom of Poland, and in 1772â€“1945 it belonged to Prussia and Germany (East Prussia).
